alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Charleston; Colleton; Dorchester; Hampton; Jasper (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 5:37PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Beaufort, Charleston, Colleton, Dorchester, Hampton and Jasper. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 534 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated a large area of thunderstorms with heavy rain moving across southern South Carolina. These storms will move over the entire flood advisory area through 7 PM and be capable of dropping another 1 to 3 inches of rain. Minor flooding is likely ongoing in a number of areas this evening where as much as 2 to locally 4 inches of rain have already fallen. The risk for minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas continues. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Beaufort, Ridgeland, Yemassee, Clarendon, Hollywood, Ravenel, Meggett, Green Pond, Ashepoo, White Hall, Ritter, Dale, Hendersonville, Jacksonboro, Gardens Corner, Sheldon, Beaufort Marine Corps Air Station, Pocotaligo, Adams Run and Laurel Bay.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Beaufort; Charleston; Colleton; Dorchester; Hampton; Jasper
